Unknown.translation: When a Sikh joins in the holy congregation and become engrossed in the divine word, the ecstasy of the spiritual waves felt by him is like the waves of the ocean.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: siqsMg dÍwrw sbd ivKy suriq dy prcwau itkwau dw Avgwhn kY ABÎws krn kr ky Awqmw ABÎwsI swDk dw Awpw gMgw smwn AwpxI inrml cYqMn srUipxI qrMg lihr auCwl mwr ky Bwv AwpxI cYqMn klw nUM swKÎwq pRgt kr ky kIkUM lhr mOj swgr smuMdR ivc AByd ho jwieAw krdw hY,

lines.gurmukhi: Agm AQwih Awih Apr Apwr Aiq; rqn pRgws iniD pUrn ghir hY [

Unknown.translation: The ocean-like Lord is beyond our reach and its depth is unfathomable. One who stays engrossed in Naam Simran and adulations of the Lord is able to realise the jewel-like treasure of the Almighty.

lines.gurmukhi: hMs mrjIvw gun gwhk cwhk sMq; ins idn Gitkw mhUrq phr hY [

Unknown.translation: The true disciple and seeker of the Lord remains a trader for the jewel-like traits of the Lord's name and he is never affected by the time of the day or night, watch, auspiciousness of the time and other rites and rituals.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: hMswˆ smwn sMq jn rwq idn, GVIAwˆ phr, mhUrq Awid smUh smÎwˆ ivKy Aru mrjIaUiVAwˆ sdRS cwhk ijgÎwsI jn isr nUM qlI aupr r`K ky jIaUˆdy hI mrx leI qXwr ho ky eynwˆ gux dy gwhk gRhx krx hwry hn[

lines.gurmukhi: sÍwNq bUMd brKw ijau gvn Gtw GmMf; hoq mukqwhl Aau nr nrhr hY [76[

Unknown.translation: As the Swati raindrop becomes a precious pearl when it falls on a clam in the deep sea, similarly when a Sikh experiences the divine unstruck music in the tenth opening (Dasam Duar) as a result of Naam Simran, he becomes God from the form of a human being
